wikipedia_page.main: Alexander Strange (27 April 1818 – 9 March 1876) was a British army officer in India and took part there in the Great Trigonometrical Survey. After retirement from the army he settled in Britain; he supervised the construction of scientific instruments used in surveying, and supported scientific research.

response: *Alexander Strange (1818–1876), British army officer involved in the Great Trigonometrical Survey

At Fort St. George he married his second wife Louisa Burroughs, daughter of Sir William Burroughs, 1st Baronet, on 11 October 1806. (His first wife Janet Anstruther, whom he married in 1797, died in 1798.) They went on to have several children, including Alexander Strange, an army officer and surveyor in India,Sir Thomas Andrew Lumisden Strange thepeerage.com. and Thomas Lumisden Strange, a judge and writer.
*Alexander Strange (1818–1876), British Indian Army officer, took part in the Great Trigonometrical Survey of India
